document_title: Gnathostomiasis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content: Medical examination: the doctor checks to see if the patient's swollen skin area moves or not. Ask whether the patient has ever eaten undercooked freshwater fish, eels, frogs, birds or reptiles or lived in an area with parasites; Blood test: find the number of eosinophils using the Elisa technique, to identify parasitic diseases; Imaging diagnosis: X-rays of the lungs, gastrointestinal tract, CT contribute to recording intracranial bleeding, meningitis...; In addition, the doctor may also ask the patient to have a sputum smear, histology test to find worm larvae, and cerebrospinal fluid puncture for diagnosis.
subsection_title: benh giun dau gai.json. How is gnathostomiasis diagnosed?
subsection_data:
benh giun dau gai.json. How is gnathostomiasis diagnosed?
Medical examination: the doctor checks to see if the patient's swollen skin area moves or not. Ask whether the patient has ever eaten undercooked freshwater fish, eels, frogs, birds or reptiles or lived in an area with parasites; Blood test: find the number of eosinophils using the Elisa technique, to identify parasitic diseases; Imaging diagnosis: X-rays of the lungs, gastrointestinal tract, CT contribute to recording intracranial bleeding, meningitis...; In addition, the doctor may also ask the patient to have a sputum smear, histology test to find worm larvae, and cerebrospinal fluid puncture for diagnosis.
